content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
─────────────────────
### Extraction System at position (-3.5, 27.5)
Consists of:
• Burner Inserter – Extraction system burner inserter placed at (–3.5, 27.5) with its drop position at (–3.5, 28.5); this unit supplies items from the extraction side into the transport line.

### Copper Cable Factory at position (2.5, 17.5)
Consists of:
• Input Chest – Cable factory input chest located at (2.5, 17.5) that buffers raw materials.
• Burner Inserter – Newly placed factory burner inserter at (3.5, 17.5) (using direction RIGHT) adjacent to the input chest; it transfers items into the processing chain.
• Assembling Machine – Assembling-machine-1 at (1.5, 19.5) that operates as the production unit for copper cable (its connections with the inserter and chest indicate integration within the factory).

### Belt Depot at position (3.5, 15.5)
Consists of:
• Wooden Chest – Deployed at (3.5, 15.5) as the isolated belt depot target.
• Transport Belt Segment – A dedicated belt segment placed at (4.5, 15.5) next to the depot chest to channel items.
• Burner Inserter – Depot burner inserter positioned at (3.5, 14.5) (using direction UP) to extract items from the depot for further transport.

ERROR TIPS
────────────
• Transport Belt Connection Issues
  – Repeated errors indicate that transport belts were attempted to be connected directly to a Prototype.SteamEngine object.
  – Ensure that an inserter is added to feed items into such entities and use the inserter as the connection target rather than the engine itself.

• Placement Distance and Inventory Errors
  – Placement failures occurred when attempting to place a wooden chest at (3.5, 15.5) while the player was too far from the target.
  – Always move close enough to the target position before placing an entity.
  – Additionally, verify that the required item (e.g. wooden chest) is present in your inventory before initiating placement.

• Variable Definition Error
  – A NameError (“target_chest is not defined”) was encountered during belt targeting.
  – Double-check variable declarations and ensure that the correct variable names are used for target entities before assignment.
